subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: ATLANTA, June 27 (AP) — When Evander Holyfield first started boxing professionally, someone asked how long he planned to trade punches. He thought 28 sounded like a reasonable age to hang up the gloves, so he went with that.
snippet: ATLANTA, June 27 (AP) — When Evander Holyfield first started boxing professionally, someone asked how long he planned to trade punches. He thought 28 sounded like a reasonable age to hang up the gloves, so he went with that.
